This async method lacks 'await' operators and will run synchronously. Consider using the 'await' operator to await non-blocking API calls, or 'await Task.Run(...)' to do CPU-bound work on a background thread.

'CartMessageListener.ProductUpdateMessage' is an internal class that is apparently never instantiated. If so, remove the code from the assembly. If this class is intended to contain only static members, make it 'static' (Module in Visual Basic).
Type 'ProductUpdateMessage' can be sealed because it has no subtypes in its containing assembly and is not externally visible

CA1031.shortDescription: Do not catch general exception types
CA1031.fullDescription: A general exception such as System.Exception or System.SystemException or a disallowed exception type is caught in a catch statement, or a general catch clause is used. General and disallowed exceptions should not be caught.

CA1050.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize related types in an object hierarchy.

CA1052.shortDescription: Static holder types should be Static or NotInheritable

CA1062.fullDescription: An externally visible method dereferences one of its reference arguments without verifying whether that argument is 'null' ('Nothing' in Visual Basic). All reference arguments that are passed to externally visible methods should be checked against 'null'. If appropriate, throw an 'ArgumentNullException' when the argument is 'null'. If the method is designed to be called only by known assemblies, you should make the method internal.

CA1063.fullDescription: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.

CA1303.shortDescription: Do not pass literals as localized parameters
CA1303.fullDescription: A method passes a string literal as a parameter to a constructor or method in the .NET Framework class library and that string should be localizable. To fix a violation of this rule, replace the string literal with a string retrieved through an instance of the ResourceManager class.

CA1812.fullDescription: An instance of an assembly-level type is not created by code in the assembly.

CA1822.fullDescription: Members that do not access instance data or call instance methods can be marked as static. After you mark the methods as static, the compiler will emit nonvirtual call sites to these members. This can give you a measurable performance gain for performance-sensitive code.

CA1852.fullDescription: When a type is not accessible outside its assembly and has no subtypes within its containing assembly, it can be safely sealed. Sealing types can improve performance.

CA2007.shortDescription: Consider calling ConfigureAwait on the awaited task
CA2007.fullDescription: When an asynchronous method awaits a Task directly, continuation occurs in the same thread that created the task. Consider calling Task.ConfigureAwait(Boolean) to signal your intention for continuation. Call ConfigureAwait(false) on the task to schedule continuations to the thread pool, thereby avoiding a deadlock on the UI thread. Passing false is a good option for app-independent libraries. Calling ConfigureAwait(true) on the task has the same behavior as not explicitly calling ConfigureAwait. By explicitly calling this method, you're letting readers know you intentionally want to perform the continuation on the original synchronization context.

CA2016.fullDescription: Forward the 'CancellationToken' parameter to methods to ensure the operation cancellation notifications gets properly propagated, or pass in 'CancellationToken.None' explicitly to indicate intentionally not propagating the token.

CA2215.shortDescription: Dispose methods should call base class dispose
CA2215.fullDescription: A type that implements System.IDisposable inherits from a type that also implements IDisposable. The Dispose method of the inheriting type does not call the Dispose method of the parent type. To fix a violation of this rule, call base.Dispose in your Dispose method.

CS1573.shortDescription: Parameter has no matching param tag in the XML comment (but other parameters do)

CS1998.shortDescription: Async method lacks 'await' operators and will run synchronously

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

CS8767.shortDescription: Nullability of reference types in type of parameter doesn't match implicitly implemented member (possibly because of nullability attributes).

S1118.shortDescription: Utility classes should not have public constructors
S1118.fullDescription: Whenever there are portions of code that are duplicated and do not depend on the state of their container class, they can be centralized inside a "utility class". A utility class is a class that only has static members, hence it should not be instantiated.

S1144.shortDescription: Unused private types or members should be removed
S1144.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when a private/internal type or member is never referenced in the code.

S2068.fullDescription: Because it is easy to extract strings from an application source code or binary, credentials should not be hard-coded. This is particularly true for applications that are distributed or that are open-source.

S3260.shortDescription: Non-derived "private" classes and records should be "sealed"
S3260.fullDescription: Classes and records with either private or file access modifiers aren’t visible outside of their assemblies or files, so if they’re not extended inside their scope, they should be made explicitly non-extensible with the addition of the sealed keyword.

S3267.shortDescription: Loops should be simplified with "LINQ" expressions
S3267.fullDescription: Using explicit loops for filtering, selecting, or aggregating elements can make code more verbose and harder to read. LINQ expressions provide a more concise and expressive way to perform these operations, improving code clarity and maintainability.

S3459.fullDescription: Fields and auto-properties that are never assigned to hold the default values for their types. They are either pointless code or, more likely, mistakes.

S3881.fullDescription: The IDisposable interface is a mechanism to release unmanaged resources, if not implemented correctly this could result in resource leaks or more severe bugs.

S3903.shortDescription: Types should be defined in named namespaces
S3903.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces in order to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize them into the object hierarchy. Types that are defined outside any named namespace are in a global namespace that cannot be referenced in code.

S6968.shortDescription: Actions that return a value should be annotated with ProducesResponseTypeAttribute containing the return type
S6968.fullDescription: In an ASP.NET Core Web API, controller actions can optionally return a result value. If a controller action returns a value in the happy path, for example ControllerBase.Ok(Object), annotating the action with one of the [ProducesResponseType] overloads that describe the type is recommended.

SA1005.shortDescription: Single line comments should begin with single space
SA1005.fullDescription: A single-line comment within a C# code file does not begin with a single space.

SA1009.shortDescription: Closing parenthesis should be spaced correctly
SA1009.fullDescription: A closing parenthesis within a C# statement is not spaced correctly.

SA1028.shortDescription: Code should not contain trailing whitespace
SA1028.fullDescription: There should not be any whitespace at the end of a line of code.

SA1101.fullDescription: A call to an instance member of the local class or a base class is not prefixed with 'this.', within a C# code file.

SA1111.shortDescription: Closing parenthesis should be on line of last parameter
SA1111.fullDescription: The closing parenthesis or bracket in a call to or declaration of a C# method/indexer/attribute/array/constructor/delegate is not placed on the same line as the last parameter.

SA1116.shortDescription: Split parameters should start on line after declaration
SA1116.fullDescription: The parameters to a C# method or indexer call or declaration span across multiple lines, but the first parameter does not start on the line after the opening bracket.

SA1200.shortDescription: Using directives should be placed correctly
SA1200.fullDescription: A C# using directive is placed outside of a namespace element.

SA1202.shortDescription: Elements should be ordered by access
SA1202.fullDescription: An element within a C# code file is out of order in relation to other elements in the code.

SA1208.shortDescription: System using directives should be placed before other using directives
SA1208.fullDescription: A using directive which declares a member of the 'System' namespace appears after a using directive which declares a member of a different namespace, within a C# code file.

SA1309.shortDescription: Field names should not begin with underscore
SA1309.fullDescription: A field name in C# begins with an underscore.

SA1413.shortDescription: Use trailing comma in multi-line initializers
SA1413.fullDescription: A multi-line initializer in a C# code file should use a comma on the last line.

SA1503.fullDescription: The opening and closing braces for a C# statement have been omitted.

SA1507.shortDescription: Code should not contain multiple blank lines in a row
SA1507.fullDescription: The C# code contains multiple blank lines in a row.

SA1513.shortDescription: Closing brace should be followed by blank line
SA1513.fullDescription: A closing brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is not followed by a blank line.

SA1516.shortDescription: Elements should be separated by blank line
SA1516.fullDescription: Adjacent C# elements are not separated by a blank line.

SA1600.fullDescription: A C# code element is missing a documentation header.

SA1601.fullDescription: A C# partial element is missing a documentation header.

SA1611.fullDescription: A C# method, constructor, delegate or indexer element is missing documentation for one or more of its parameters.

SA1629.shortDescription: Documentation text should end with a period
SA1629.fullDescription: A section of the XML header documentation for a C# element does not end with a period.

SA1633.fullDescription: A C# code file is missing a standard file header.
